qas.question: When was Gaddafi's son by Fatiha al-Nuri born?
What was the maiden surname of Gaddafi's second wife?
What tribe did Safia Farkash belong to?

context: Gaddafi married his first wife, Fatiha al-Nuri, in 1969. She was the daughter of <a0_0>General Khalid<a0_0/>, a senior figure in King Idris' administration, and was from a middle-class background. Although they had one son, Muhammad Gaddafi (b. <a1_0>1970<a1_0/>), their relationship was strained, and they divorced in 1970. Gaddafi's second wife was Safia Farkash, née <a2_0>el-Brasai<a2_0/>, a former nurse from <a3_0>Obeidat<a3_0/> tribe born in Bayda. They met in 1969, following his ascension to power, when he was hospitalized with appendicitis; he claimed that it was love at first sight. The couple remained married until his death. Together they had seven biological children: Saif al-Islam Gaddafi (b. 1972), Al-Saadi Gaddafi (b. 1973), Mutassim Gaddafi (1974–2011), Hannibal Muammar Gaddafi (b. 1975), Ayesha Gaddafi (b. 1976), Saif al-Arab Gaddafi (1982–2011), and Khamis Gaddafi (1983–<a4_0>2011<a4_0/>). He also adopted two children, Hanna Gaddafi and Milad Gaddafi.
